text: The 2019–20 Swiss Super League (referred to as the Raiffeisen Super League for sponsoring reasons) was the 123rd season of top-tier competitive football in Switzerland and the 17th under its current name and format. A total of 10 teams competed in the league: the 9 best teams from the 2018–19 season and the 2018–19 Swiss Challenge League champions Servette. Young Boys were the defending champions. They successfully retained the title. On 28 February Swiss Football League postponed all Super and Challenge League matches of matchdays 24, 25 and 26. Postponement came after the Swiss Federal Council banned all major events until 15 March due to the COVID-19 outbreak. On 13 March Super and Challenge League football was halted at least until the end of April; however, the season was resumed on 19 June. ==Teams== ===Stadia and locations=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !Club !Location !Stadium !Capacity |- |Basel |Basel |St. Jakob-Park | align="center" |37,994 |- |Lugano |Lugano |Stadio Cornaredo | align="center" |6,390 |- |Luzern |Lucerne |Swissporarena | align="center" |16,490 |- |Neuchâtel Xamax |Neuchâtel |Stade de la Maladière | align="center" | 11,997 |- |Servette |Geneva |Stade de Genève | align="center" |30,084 |- | |Sion |Stade Tourbillon | align="center" |14,283 |- |St. Gallen |St. Gallen |Kybunpark | align="center" |19,456 |- |Thun |Thun |Stockhorn Arena | align="center" |10,014 |- |Young Boys |Bern |Stade de Suisse | align="center" |31,789 |- |Zürich |Zürich |Letzigrund | align="center" |26,104 |} === Personnel and kits === {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: left; font-size:100%" |- !
